body:
Hmm...

Can you try turning off multi thread copy with `--multi-thread-streams 0`?

Do you know which FTP server this is? As in what version of software?

It might be worth getting wireshark out to see if you can see what is happening?

A status messages as an error generally indicates rclone and the server have got out of sync somehow.

`--multi-thread-streams 0` seems to remove the problem (transferred 60GB successfully)

I also tested `--multi-thread-streams 0` with `concurrency = 3` since I'm allowed 3 simultaneous connections on that FTP server and it works as well.

After a successful copy, I tried again without `--multi-thread-streams 0` and it worked *as long as there were no files to download* (i.e. no differences). I got the "hanging" again over the 3 connections if forced a redownload of some files by deleting them on the destination.

I don't control the FTP server so unfortunately I most likely can't give all its details. Here's what I found:
```
ftp> rhelp
---> HELP
214-The following SITE commands are recognized
 ALIAS
 CHMOD
 IDLE
 UTIME
214 Pure-FTPd - http://pureftpd.org/
ftp> status
Connected to ftp.redacted.net.
No proxy connection.
Connecting using address family: any.
Mode: stream; Type: binary; Form: non-print; Structure: file
Verbose: on; Bell: off; Prompting: on; Globbing: on
Store unique: off; Receive unique: off
Case: off; CR stripping: on
Quote control characters: on
Ntrans: off
Nmap: off
Hash mark printing: off; Use of PORT cmds: on
Tick counter printing: off
```

So I guess it's Pure-FTPd as the server. If more info is required, I could always open a ticket with the hosting provider asking for the actual version.

I was able to reproduce the issue in a VM running Ubuntu server 18.04LTS.

This is the ftp server package I used:
`pure-ftpd/bionic,now 1.0.46-1build1 amd64 [installed]`

So I can reproduce this issue by connecting to a localhost pure-ftpd server to run the `rclone copy`

A first test with smaller files did not reproduce the issue, but using larger files (1GB) did reproduce the issue with `failed: 150 1.369 seconds (measured here), 187.00 Mbytes per second`.

The files were generated with:
`dd if=/dev/urandom of=./1 bs=4k iflag=fullblock,count_bytes count=1G`
Note that from local dir to ftp does not exhibit the same problem in my tests.

> `--multi-thread-streams 0` seems to remove the problem (transferred 60GB successfully)

Good, at least we have a work-around :-)

> After a successful copy, I tried again without `--multi-thread-streams 0` and it worked _as long as there were no files to download_ (i.e. no differences). I got the "hanging" again over the 3 connections if forced a redownload of some files by deleting them on the destination.

So it sounds like a definite problem with the multi thread download and the FTP backend.

Thanks for your instructions on how to replicate - I manged to replicate them locally here too.

This seems to be dependent on the size of the file transferred.

I do a multithread copy from pureftp in the integration tests, but it never fails... The file transferred is only 128k though.  If I bump that up to 10M then I can see it failing

I see this with wireshark.  Note these two packets are
- sequential
- on the same tcp connection

Note the `150-` message then the `150 ` message which indicates end of message.  This is followed by another `150 ` message in the next frame which isn't allowed.

So I think this is a bug in pureftpd, specifically due to its handling of REST (which is what multi thread downloads use).

It turns out there is an issue open for this already: https://github.com/jedisct1/pure-ftpd/issues/138

In the capture for the successful test the `measured here` messages comes correctly in the 226 message.

```
Frame 90: 128 bytes on wire (1024 bits), 128 bytes captured (1024 bits)
Ethernet II, Src: 00:00:00_00:00:00 (00:00:00:00:00:00), Dst: 00:00:00_00:00:00 (00:00:00:00:00:00)
Internet Protocol Version 4, Src: 127.0.0.1, Dst: 127.0.0.1
Transmission Control Protocol, Src Port: 21, Dst Port: 48416, Seq: 742, Ack: 125, Len: 62
File Transfer Protocol (FTP)
    150-Accepted data connection\r\n
        Response code: File status okay; about to open data connection (150)
        Response arg: Accepted data connection
    150 32768.0 kbytes to download\r\n
[Current working directory: ]
```

```
Frame 91: 128 bytes on wire (1024 bits), 128 bytes captured (1024 bits)
Ethernet II, Src: 00:00:00_00:00:00 (00:00:00:00:00:00), Dst: 00:00:00_00:00:00 (00:00:00:00:00:00)
Internet Protocol Version 4, Src: 127.0.0.1, Dst: 127.0.0.1
Transmission Control Protocol, Src Port: 21, Dst Port: 48416, Seq: 804, Ack: 125, Len: 62
File Transfer Protocol (FTP)
    150 0.014 seconds (measured here), 1665.27 Mbytes per second\r\n
        Response code: File status okay; about to open data connection (150)
        Response arg: 0.014 seconds (measured here), 1665.27 Mbytes per second
[Current working directory: ]
```

rename.from: rclone copy from ftp to local directory hangs
rename.to: FTP:  multi thread copies hang when server is pure-ftpd

body:
Good catch! That motivated me to do some "light" reading of the FTP RFC to understand those multi-line replies. :)

Not sure what you can do on your end then. I'm curious to know how Filezilla or lftp handle such an invalid response from the server though.
The problem is triggered by the multi thread downloads. I imagine that FileZilla and lftp don't do those by default.

It seems that https://github.com/jedisct1/pure-ftpd/ nuked all their issues. I can't find any issue tracker on the official website; only a commercial support offer (https://www.pureftpd.org/project/pure-ftpd/support/)

Not sure how to track this one now!

> It seems that https://github.com/jedisct1/pure-ftpd/ nuked all their issues. I can't find any issue tracker on the official website; only a commercial support offer (https://www.pureftpd.org/project/pure-ftpd/support/)

Yes I noticed that a while back :-(
 
> Not sure how to track this one now!

I contacted the author on twitter and his reply was "send a patch".  So that is always an option!

issue.title: Rclone hangs during restic restore

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
<!--

Welcome :-) We understand you are having a problem with rclone; we want to help you with that!

If you've just got a question or aren't sure if you've found a bug then please use the rclone forum:

    https://forum.rclone.org/

instead of filing an issue for a quick response.

If you think you might have found a bug, please can you try to replicate it with the latest beta?

    https://beta.rclone.org/
    
If you can still replicate it with the latest beta, then please fill in the info below which makes our lives much easier.  A log with -vv will make our day :-)

Thank you

The Rclone Developers

-->

#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?

Rclone hangs when paired with restic.

#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)

rclone v1.51.0-042-g219bd97e-beta (stable also hangs the same way)

#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)

Linux leto 4.19.0-8-amd64 #1 SMP Debian 4.19.98-1 (2020-01-26) x86_64 GNU/Linux

####  Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)

FTP

#### The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

`restic -r rclone:ftp:docker -p rpw restore latest -t tmp -i docker/admin`

#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (eg output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

```
repository bb5ecaf2 opened successfully, password is correct
restoring <Snapshot 9632f3c6 of [/root/docker] at 2020-02-19 10:26:41.170231085 +0100 CET by root@leto> to tmp
```
And it hangs there forever.

After sending -quit from another console:

body:
I have attempted to make a workaround in rclone for this - testing appreciated!

https://beta.rclone.org/branch/v1.51.0-065-gaa9c5858-fix-3445-pureftp-beta/ (uploaded in 15-30 mins)
I've merged this fix to master now which means it will be in [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org) in 15-30 mins and released in v1.52

I tested your beta version and confirmed that my local VM test now works. Before doing that I also confirmed that the latest release still fails with the test scenario.

I can't really test it on the production server at this time, but I think you have that covered in #3984 anyway!
